channel.title: Your favorite Boss battle?
channel.description:
Boss battles. A staple of video games since Mario Bros. on the NES starting with King Koopa. But since then there have been many, many more Boss battles to be had. Good ones are memorable, epic, and just plain awesome. So what's your favorite boss?
Mine would have to be Metal Gear Rex vs Ray in MGS4. I mean wow. Holy fuck. Everything about this boss battle SCREAMS balls to the wall epic. The story behind it, the setting, the environment, the mechs, and the characters in both of them. This was just orgasmic to play for the first time. Hell, any time really. The sound of metal shredding metal, explosions everywhere, debris flying off of buildings as they are blown apart in the crossfire of an epic battle. All climaxing with one of the best cut-scenes in Metal Gear history.
[url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d8ptKV1FC6M[/url]
TL;DR:
God damn this is good.

item.description:
An awesome boss “battle” was Braid’s “rescue the princess” finale. Getting to the end and then seeing the whole thing play back was mind-bendingly awesome.

Read full topic

item.title: Your favorite Boss battle?
item.dc:creator: Slowpokes_Bro
item.description:
Favorite boss battle has to be the one with Cackletta in Mario and Luigi Superstar sage. If you still have a Gameboy or a DS that can play the games, I highly recommend this game. The only reason I like this one though is because I love the music in it. Sure it loops and might get annoying at times, it just seemed so epic when I was playing this game in I think 4th or 5th grade. This also seemed true for many of the other boss fights. A lot of them did have this same song, but there was an occasional boss battle with different music that was just as epic.

If you don’t mind Mario RPGs on the Gameboy, play this game, it is very much worth it.

Read full topic

item.title: Your favorite Boss battle?
item.dc:creator: MechUnit
item.description:
my fav boss battles:

  1. Microcosm (AMIGA CD32) player vs. Grey M (the endboss), because G’M was so perfect designed that you thougt he could be alive!
  2. Einhänder (PSone) player vs. “monkey bot”, because he moved like he did robodance and i think in reality a human like robot like him in this size would also move like this.
    at these two boss battles also the music was great.

Read full topic

item.title: Your favorite Boss battle?
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
project_isaac:

nah, emerald weapon was better

I’d go with Ruby Weapon over Emerald Weapon. Emerald was a large health bar that didn’t really do anything special. Ruby would immediately kill one of your party members and take another out of the battle permanently if you didn’t start it with only one person alive. Emerald’s special attack is completely avoidable and does damage based on the amount of materia you have equipped. Ruby has a lot of devastating attacks that aren’t considered his special.

For someone who doesn’t particularly enjoy boss fights, I sure do like the strategy behind them

Read full topic

item.title: Your favorite Boss battle?
item.dc:creator: Samapico
item.description:
Fuskox:

I’m gonna say this even though I may get flamed. Just torrent the iso and play it on Dolphin emulator with a console controller. You just need an ok system, and it works out fine.

That’s how I did it =)

That’s what I did as well… and it was an awesome game.

I was also playing Metroid Prime on Dolphin, but the damn thing was crashing pretty often, I got tired of it, even though the game is great.
I’m a huge Super Metroid fan, and I had not played any Metroid Prime game until then. Just starting the game gave me a boner.

Read full topic

item.title: Your favorite Boss battle?
item.dc:creator: Chrillen
item.description:
I normally don’t like boss battles, I prefer the way they’re handled in HL2, but if I have a least favorite boss battle, it’s Hades from GOW3. I sucked so much at that, it offered me to go to easy mode instead.

Which I kindly accepted.
